zone.line: And as to what he meant by heaping coals
Perhaps he to
To make it —-
Here my dear friend, is a new book for you
I have already dedicated two
To other friends, one female & one male
Ane Which What you are, is a thing that I
can this be must veil
What What is thy to those who praise or
rail?
I never was attached to that great sect
Whose doctrine is that each one should
select
Out of the crowd a mistress or a friend
wise
And all the rest, though fair & commend
To cold oblivion — though it is the
code
Of England modern morals, & the beaten road
Which those poor slaves with weary foot
ourline steps
Who travel to their home among the tread
dead
By the broad highway of the world, & so
True love has this, different from
gold & clay
That to divide is not to take away
With one sad friend & many a jealous foe
The dreariest & the longest journey go
